data.title: STATEMENT BY HIS EXCELLENCY BHARRAT JAGDEO, PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF GUYANA, 13 JANUARY 2010, ON THE EARTHQUAKE IN HAITI - Haiti
data.meta_description: News and Press Release in English on Haiti about Contributions and Earthquake; published on 13 Jan 2010 by CARICOM
data.text:
I was deeply shocked and saddened at the extent of the destruction caused by the catastrophic earthquake which devastated our sister nation of Haiti yesterday. The haunting images of bodies, injured persons and ruined buildings struck a chord of compassion throughout our nation for the people of Haiti.

Haiti as the poorest country in the western hemisphere is now severely challenged to cope with this tragedy. Haiti needs all countries, including the small developing countries to come to its aid urgently.

The Government of Guyana has pledged US$1 million to bring some relief to the people of Haiti.

I will be convening a meeting at 2.00 p.m. today with representatives of Political Parties and Non-Governmental Organisations to coordinate a national response to aid in the recovery effort.
